import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.offline as pyo
import plotly.graph_objs as go
from plotly.offline import iplot
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline

figure = plt.figure(figsize=(30,20))
sns.barplot(y="Country", x="Total",data=df)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Total Medal')
plt.ylabel('Country')
plt.title('Country by Total Medal')
plt.show;

source.47415dfe:
#NESTED!!
trace1 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],  
    y=top['Gold Medal'],
    name = 'Gold',
    marker=dict(color='#FFD700') 
)
trace2 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],
    y=top['Silver Medal'],
    name='Silver',
    marker=dict(color='#9EA0A1') 
)
trace3 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],
    y=top['Bronze Medal'],
    name='Bronze',
    marker=dict(color='#CD7F32') 
)
data = [trace1, trace2, trace3]
layout = go.Layout(
    title='2021 Olympic Medals by Country'
)
fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig)
source.3693371c:
trace1 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],  
    y=top['Gold Medal'],
    name = 'Gold',
    marker=dict(color='#FFD700') 
)
trace2 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],
    y=top['Silver Medal'],
    name='Silver',
    marker=dict(color='#9EA0A1') 
)
trace3 = go.Bar(
    x=top['Country'],
    y=top['Bronze Medal'],
    name='Bronze',
    marker=dict(color='#CD7F32') 
)
data = [trace3, trace2, trace1]
layout = go.Layout(
    title='2021 Olympic Medals by Country',barmode='stack'
)
fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig)
